title: How to replace wheel studs on drum brakes - Quora

response.answer_text: Easy job put the nut onto stud wind down until top of stud is flush with nut eg the stud is level with nut not protruding past the nut thread now hit the nut with a 2lb + hammer and force the stud into the drum braking area it is held in place by spines in the drum and on the lower part of stud replace with new stud by fitting stud into rear of drum aligning splines and tapping it into place ending with harder hammering until flush with drum surface

You need hydraulic press. Probably one withat least a 10 ton capacity. because no amount of hammering will do it safely. I had it done once, because mopar went through a left hand thread phase in the 60’s. And sourcing lug bolts became an issue, and impact wrenches would over tighten them. granted, these were probably 60 yrs old, and not tapered, and most definitely swaged and/or seized in place, so a modern drum may not be as ludicrously tight.
